definition: few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
(once) again/also/both... and.../and yet/(used for emphasis) anyway
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom

sentences.english: And why is there so little actual reporting on the process of science?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼目前關於科學發展真實的報道少之又少呢？

sentences.english: There are many people who die everyday but only a few are remembered.
sentences.chinese: 每天都有很多人死去，但能被人們想起的卻少之又少。

sentences.english: But the government did little to integrate its migrant populations.
sentences.chinese: 但是政府對於他的移民人口做的東西少之又少。

sentences.english: Though births have been reported, they are few and far between it.
sentences.chinese: 雖然已有小熊貓誕生，但數量少之又少。

sentences.english: But outside America's technology hubs, such people are rare.
sentences.chinese: 但是在美國科技中心之外，這樣的人少之又少。

sentences.english: With just six rooms, very few people will ever get to say they've been.
sentences.chinese: 由於該酒店只有六間房間，能夠入住的人少之又少。

sentences.english: Furthermore, the researches focused on senior high school students'writing errors are fewer.
sentences.chinese: 針對高中生二語寫作錯誤的研究更是少之又少。

sentences.english: It can be hard to find people who accept full responsibility for their mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 而肯爲自己的錯誤承擔全部責任的人，實在少之又少。

sentences.english: But little information on Sagawa exists beyond that.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，關於佐川的信息少之又少。

definition: just a very few (idiom); tiny number/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
lit. as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns (idiom)/fig. few and far between
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
just a very few (idiom); tiny number/just a handful/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
there are plenty of such people
rare as morning stars (idiom)/few and far between/sparse
as many as the hair of the ox (idiom)/great amount of/countless
